label: phenotype
description: A (combination of) quality(ies) of an organism determined by the interaction of its genetic make-up and environment that differentiates specific instances of a species from other instances of the same species.

label: NaCl optimum
description: The specific concentration of sodium chloride at which a microorganism exhibits maximum growth rate and metabolic efficiency.

label: temperature range observation
description: An observation specializing temperature observation for growth temperature range data.

label: respiration
description: An organism's observable and characteristic method of performing cellular respiration, distinguished primarily by the specific terminal electron acceptor its metabolic pathways utilize for the purpose of producing cellular energy.

label: material entity
description: An object or portion of a substance or mixture of substances that consists of matter

label: temperature range (growth tolerance)
description: The span of temperatures within which an organism can grow

label: pH optimum (metabolic efficiency)
description: The specific hydrogen ion concentration at which a microorganism achieves its maximum growth rate and metabolic efficiency.
